articles.author: Faye Welch
articles.title: Europe launches a new mission to Venus | Science - Commentary Box Sports
articles.description: After the success of the Venus Express probe (2005-2014), the European Space Agency announced that Europe wants to explore the planet again with EnVision.
articles.content: Venus holds another set of secrets, chief among which is why our closest, similar in size and composition, has been subjected to such extreme climate change. The answer to the question can learn more… [+1056 chars]

articles.author: Robin George Andrews
articles.title: Venus Will Have a Fleet of Spacecraft as Europe Adds Orbiter Mission - The New York Times
articles.description: The EnVision spacecraft will complement two NASA missions announced last week, ending the relative loneliness of a planet sometimes thought of as Earth’s twin.
articles.content:
Some of those answers lie on Earth, but some of them lie on Venus, Dr. Wilson said.
EnVision will study those mysteries with a suite of advanced scientific instruments. Its radar systems will peer t… [+2281 chars]

articles.author: Sky
articles.title: Venus: European Space Agency mission aims to unlock mysteries of 'Earth's twin' - Sky News
articles.description: Venus is the most Earth-like planet in size, composition and distance to our sun - but its surface is about 450C (842F).
